City of Kansas City, MO.

Leaf and brush pickup is underway

This season’s leaf and brush collection began April 8. Residents who live in the City’s South Zone will receive collection the week of April 8. Residents who live in the City’s Central Zone will receive collection the week of April 15. Residents who live in the City’s North Zone will receive collection the week of [...]

DEPARTMENT HOME

April is Jazz Appreciation Month!

April is Jazz Appreciation Month , You can find jazz playing almost every day in Kansas City, notably at the 18th & Vine District, home of the American Jazz Museum . KC jazz-specific calendars are maintained by sites like  Jazz Near You . Local jazzman Chris Burnett has listed six ways you can appreciate jazz. Listen to this uniquely American art form [...]

Read More

New issue of KCMOre magazine is online

In the Spring/Summer 2019 issue of KCMOre : Nile Valley Aquaponics and its impact on our community, the new Parks & Rec Director, GO KC projects, a winter wrap-up, City resources and much more. You can read it online right now. Residents will receive a print copy in their mailbox in the coming weeks.

Read More

Potholes!

Report potholes to 311 !   City crews have been working hard to keep up with Mother Nature. Potholes have been a big problem this year. Multiple rounds of wet winter storms have caused five times as many potholes compared to last year’s milder winter. As of March 29, crews patched 4,046 of potholes requested through 311, with 2,439 open cases […]

IS THERE ANYTHING WRONG WITH THIS PAGE?
Please note: this form is for alerting City Communications regarding issues on KCMO.gov web pages. Problems using web applications, such as paying fines online, should be reported to 311. Please include your contact information if you'd like a response.
